Blurb: With more than 1.5b speakers, English is the most widely spoken language on earth and is the major global hub for linguistic connections.

Once the eponymous lingua franca, French has waned relative to English in its global reach, but is still a major node for linguistic connections. Cultures as disparate as Korean, Persian and Russian have significant populations who speak the language of Voltaire and Hugo.
Comparatively few non-natives speak Chinese. Even Japanese and Koreans don’t appear to be learning in droves.
